KPU Minta Pemerintah Dukung Anggaran hingga Sosialisasi Pilkada 2020
05 Nov 2019, 16:33 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - Komisi Pemilihan Umum (KPU) meminta dukungan pemerintah pusat dan daerah untuk melaksanakan Pilkada Serentak 2020. KPU menyebut ada tiga hal yang perlu dukungan optimal.
"Kita berharap pemerintah dan juga pemerintah daerah memberikan dukungan yang optimal pada tiga hal," ujar Komisioner KPU Wahyu Setiawan di kantor KPU, Jl Imam Bonjol, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Dukungan pertama terkait dengan anggaran Pilkada 2020. Wahyu mengatakan masih terdapat lima daerah yang belum menandatangani Naskah Perjanjian Hibah Daerah (NPHD).
"Pertama, dukungan anggaran. Ini yang disampaikan ada lima daerah yang belum melaksanakan NPHD," kata Wahyu.
Selain itu, KPU membutuhkan bantuan terkait sumber daya manusia. Menurutnya, pihaknya membutuhkan banyak personel untuk penyelenggaraan tahapan pilkada.
"Berikutnya dukungan personel kita juga minta pada pemerintah dan pemerintah daerah, agar daerah-daerah yang sedang melakukan tahapan pilkada, pegawai yang merupakan pegawai pemerintah daerah itu tidak ditarik menjadi pegawai daerah. Karena kita juga punya kebutuhan personel untuk menyelenggarakan tahapan pilkada," kata Wahyu.
Selain itu, pemerintah diminta dukungan sosialisasi tahapan Pilkada 2020. Dia berharap dengan bantuan sosialisasi, partisipasi masyarakat dalam pilkada bisa mencapai 82 persen.
"Ketiga, kita juga minta pada pemerintah dan pemerintah daerah untuk memberikan dukungan sosialisasi, dalam rangka meningkatkan dukungan masyarakat," ujar Wahyu.
"Kita tahu, partisipasi politik pada Pemilu serentak mencapai 82 persen. Kita berharap partisipasi politik pada Pilkada Serentak 2020, juga relatif akan pada derajat yang sama," sambungnya.

KPU Asks the Government to Support the Budget until the 2020 Election Socialization
05 Nov 2019, 16:33 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - The General Election Commission (KPU) requests the support of the central and regional governments to implement the 2020 Simultaneous Election. The KPU mentions that there are three things that need optimal support.
"We hope that the government and local governments also provide optimal support for three things," said Commissioner Commissioner Wahyu Setiawan at the KPU office, Jl Imam Bonjol, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
The first support is related to the 2020 local election budget. Wahyu said there were still five regions that had not yet signed the Regional Grant Agreement (NPHD) Text.
"First, budget support. This was conveyed by five regions that have not yet implemented NPHD," Wahyu said.
In addition, the KPU needs help related to human resources. According to him, his party needed a lot of personnel to organize the stages of the elections.
"Next, our personnel support also asks the government and regional governments, so that the regions that are conducting the election stage, employees who are regional government employees are not drawn into regional employees. Because we also have personnel needs to carry out the election stage," Wahyu .
In addition, the government was asked to support the socialization of the 2020 elections. He hopes that with the assistance of socialization, community participation in the elections can reach 82 percent.
"Third, we also ask the government and regional governments to provide socialization support, in order to increase public support," Wahyu said.
"We know that political participation in elections simultaneously reaches 82 percent. We hope that political participation in the Simultaneous Election in 2020 will also be relatively at the same level," he continued.
